CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 2, 1939, pg. 8, reads: "Charming Out-Of-Towners - Pittsburgh is flooded these days with charming visitors...and here are three: Left to right, Helen Viverette of New York; Dorothy Craig of Atlantic City and Noble Peyton of Hampton, Va.  Miss Craig was guest of the Ted Pages, Miss Viverette was guest of relatives and Mr. Peyton has been a student at Pitt's summer school. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Helen Viverette smiling and wearing short sleeved striped shirt, Dorothy Craig, and Noble Peyton posed on staircase, another version
